meanings.definition: affected by lethargy; sluggish and apathetic
meanings.sent1: After a big meal, he felt lethargic and just wanted to nap.
meanings.sent2: The cat looked lethargic as it lazily stretched out in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The lethargic sloth moved so slowly that even the snail passed it.
meanings.sent4: The stagnant pond mirrored the lethargic pace of the sleepy town.
meanings.sent5: Her lethargic movements resembled a turtle trudging through thick mud.

meanings.definition: a person who is lethargic; a sluggish person
meanings.sent1: The lethargic in the office always took long breaks.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the office lethargic due to her slow work pace.
meanings.sent3: The lethargic in the race finished last but with a big smile.
meanings.sent4: The lethargic at the party was content just sitting and observing.
meanings.sent5: The lethargic in the group always brought a calming presence.
